1121.content:
You are sitting in your English classroom, getting started on the homework that your teacher gave out. The paper really wasn't the first thought on your mind though, your first thought was your bladder. It was already 1 o'clock in the afternoon, and you hadn't used the bathroom since you had gotten up this morning. You raise your hand up, signaling your teacher to you. "Mr. Ekans?" you ask quietly. "May I please use the bathroom? I will be in and out, I pro-" "No! You can go after class, I am through getting in trouble with administration for letting you guys use it." scolded Mr. Ekans.
 
         Figures, the only time this year that you needed to use the bathroom, and the old grouch won't let you go. You decide to concentrate on your homework to ease the pressure, the period ended in 30 minutes, so you needed to hang on for that long. By the time 25 minutes go by, though, you feel yourself concentrating more and more on holding it in, almost to the point of losing control. You are now stuck in a moral dilemma, should you RUN OUT OF CLASS, or should you WAIT IT OUT?

"You've got detention for leaving early, boy!" shouts Mr. E from his classroom door. You keep shuffling down the hallway, oblivious to your teacher's threats. Your main priority is relieving yourself. As you round the corner of the hallway next to the bathroom, you accidentally knock into someone who also wasn't paying attention. While you manage to keep on your feet, the other person has been knocked down on their butt, with their books and papers scattered across the hallway. While you could help them pick up their mess, you might still piss yourself, even though you are 30 feet from the boys bathroom.


So, will you help your fallen peer, or will you ignore them and relieve yourself?

You drop your backpack next to set of lockers, and rush over to see if the person was okay. "Oh my god, are you alright?" you ask. You get down on one knee and take a closer look at the girl on the floor. She has shiny black hair which goes down to her shoulders, and deep, green eyes. "Yeah, I think I'm okay. Would you mind helping me up?" she asks cheerily, almost as if getting knocked down didn't even faze her.

You are relieved, if you had hurt her, you would've felt so terrible! You help her up, and start collecting her strewn items from the floor. "By the way," you add "I'm SUPER sorry for not looking, I was just in a rush an-" She stops you, while waving her hands. "No no no no no no, I was the stupid one here. I heard you run up, saw you rush around the corner, and I still walked right into you. I'm totally fine, don't worry!

You collect all of her gear, and greet each other. After telling her your name, she tells you hers. "I'm Sophie, nice to meet you." she says. "Well, it was nice running into you, but I've gotta get back to class. I hope we bump into each other again!" With that, she trots off, and you grab your bag and rush into the boys bathroom. You pull down your pants as quickly as possible, foregoing the traditional opening of your pants for the quick way. After that, you begin to release your very full bladder into the urinal, and your face turns from fear to pleased.

Your face quickly goes back to fearful as a large figure sprints into the bathroom, and sticks a knife into your back. "No hard feelings, but I want your phone and your backpack." he says menacingly. "Well, I'm kinda busy at the moment, so you can just take them, asshole." you snap back at the thief. The way the figure is positioned just behind you makes it impossible to see his face as he grabs your smartphone and backpack. You might be crazy, but you think of a plan to stop him in his tracks and get your stuff back!

Your parents had gone on holiday until a week before the summer break ends, and you and your little sister, Kate, were at home while your older sister, Michelle, was out with her friends, and you didn't expect her home until the early hours of tomorrow morning. You had assured her that you could look after Kate on your own, so that she could go out and celebrate her friends 21st birthday.

You generally got along well with your sisters, besides the usual sibling fights. Kate looked up to you, and was always mithering you to play with her. Michelle was kind and protective over you, although she often teased her "baby brother" as she called you many times.

You glance over at the clock, and see that it is gone nine o'clock. Kate's bedtime was at eight, and you pause the game, quickly rushing to get her to bed. Once she's ready, you put her in one of her pullups, since she sometimes had accidents.

Once she was asleep, you resumed your game, playing until it was gone midnight. You decided against staying up too late, and ended up hitting the sack at 12.30.

"We're not being naughty!" Tom said. They hated when you threatened to tell their parents all the things they did while they were out. They get grounded for ages. It's one of the few satisfactions you get from this particular job.

"Well let's see if you can keep that up," you said. "Otherwise your parents will know everything."

They didn't look happy. But for once, they did as you said. You actually had an okay evening. They weren't well behaved /all/ the time but they still made an effort! But sometimes, they would look at each other, or whisper to each other, and they'd get a grin on their face. Probably just some silly injoke that is only funny to kids, you thought. And unless they start acting up then it's nothing to concern yourself over.

Soon enough, it's time for bed, for all of you. You're even more surprised when they willingly drag themselves to their rooms, brush their teeth and sleep in bed, grinning the entire time. You decide to stay up for a bit, but soon enough you get sleepy enough, and head to the spare room to sleep for the night.

The kids wait until about an hour after you started sleeping, and then started their own plans. See, they had agreed that if you even threatened to tell their parents that they were being bad, they were going to get you back.

They silently giggled as they went into the spare room. They slowly opened the door to check if you were sleeping. They see you, sleeping peacefully. They try to stifle giggles as they pull out a tape player. Making sure not to disturb you too much, they put the earphones in your ears. There's already a tape in there which they ordered online a while ago, using their parents' credit card.

They turn the tape on, then quickly head out of the room before they burst from pent up giggles. Once outside, they giggle freely. "So what do we do now?" Tom asked.

"The instructions said that we just make her listen to it for half an hour, and it will force her brain to respond to the two keywords," Emily said.

"And that'll make her... have an accident, no matter what she's doing?" Tom said amidst giggles. Emily just nodded, grinning. "What are the keywords?"

"The great thing is that they're just everyday words that could happen in a normal conversation! So while she's under the effects of the hypnosis, she could 'have an accident' at any time depending on what they talk about," she said, giggling mischievously. "For #1 it's Sky, for #2 it's Sand."

"And how long does it last?"

"That's another good thing about it. There's a phrase to stop it that wouldn't usually be uttered in every day conversation. 'You are released' will... well... release her," Emily said.

Tom giggled some more. "So what do we do now?"

"Wait and hope she doesn't wake up until it's taken effect," Emily said. "And after that, we can have some fun," she added, with a giggle.
